overview: At the end of his life, before lying down a last time in the snow, Robert Walser, Swiss writer at the margins of academic litterature, compiled on various found carboards what has been called his microgrammes : shorts texts written in a microscopic way in a langage we long time thought was indecipherable.  This film, shot with an old mobile phone, is an experimental biopic of Walser, a tribute to microgrammes, an ode to poor cinema and the minuscule poetry of things.
title: Poème des loups
